programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Shedding light on the lives of the Kamayura People, who reside in Brazils Xingu Indigenous Park. For the Kamayura, pleasing the spirits is crucial to maintaining good health, and during one key festival, a warrior must dance for hours to appease a bird spirit, sustained only by food and drink brought to him by villagers. In Ethiopia, belief drives the residents of the Tigray region to climb a 400-metre mountain to reach their church. In Switzerland, the Zermatt air rescue team offers an insight into why millions of hikers, climbers and skiers visit the Swiss Alps every year, despite the risk of injury - or even death

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom learns Margo has been keeping appointments at a mysterious address and immediately leaps to the conclusion that she is having an affair - but doesnt know how to break the news to Jerry. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Keith

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker courageously puts his ministerial career in the balance by deciding to inform the prime minister of British arms sales to Italian terrorists. Sir Humphrey launches a frantic damage-limitation exercise to ensure vested interests arent compromised. Political comedy, with Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Oh, Doctor Beeching!
programme.desc: Harry the signalman has fattened up a lovely turkey in time for Christmas, but the turkey seems to have other plans. Comedy, starring Su Pollard. First broadcast 8 July 1996

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: In an attempt to leave the men free for front-line fighting, Mainwaring and Wilson decide to recruit women into the platoon to take care of the more tedious tasks such as polishing brass. However, the captain loses his heart to an attractive widow, and it is not long before gossip spreads. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier, with a guest appearance by Carmen Silvera

programme.title: The Signalman
programme.desc: Denholm Elliott stars in this adaptation of Charles Dickens ghost story about a lonely signalman haunted by a spectral figure who appears to bring a warning of impending danger

programme.title: Murder on the Victorian Railway
programme.desc: Drama-documentary examining the death of banker Thomas Briggs in July 1864, which was the first murder to be committed on a British train. The film uses testimonies from court transcripts, memoirs, letters and newspaper reports to tell the story of the crime through those connected to it, including engine driver Alfred Ekin - who found the body - and Richard Tanner, the detective in charge of the investigation. It also explores the huge public outcry and debate it provoked. Narrated by Toby Jones

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Joy of (Train) Sets: The Model Railway Story
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the popularity of train replicas, and how what started out as an adult obsession with building fully engineered model railways became the iconic toy of 1950s and 1960s childhood. With contributions from modellers such as Pete Waterman, this programme celebrates the joys of miniaturisation

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Engine That Powers the World: Timeshift
programme.desc: Looking at the surprising story of the diesel engine - a 19th-century invention that is the hidden powerhouse behind the globalised world and is now indispensable. Car enthusiast Mark Evans gets hands on with Rudolf Diesels original creation, including vintage submarines, tractors, locomotive trains and container ships

programme.title: Murder on the Victorian Railway
programme.desc: Drama-documentary examining the death of banker Thomas Briggs in July 1864, which was the first murder to be committed on a British train. The film uses testimonies from court transcripts, memoirs, letters and newspaper reports to tell the story of the crime through those connected to it, including engine driver Alfred Ekin - who found the body - and Richard Tanner, the detective in charge of the investigation. It also explores the huge public outcry and debate it provoked. Narrated by Toby Jones

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Shedding light on the lives of the Kamayura People, who reside in Brazils Xingu Indigenous Park. For the Kamayura, pleasing the spirits is crucial to maintaining good health, and during one key festival, a warrior must dance for hours to appease a bird spirit, sustained only by food and drink brought to him by villagers. In Ethiopia, belief drives the residents of the Tigray region to climb a 400-metre mountain to reach their church. In Switzerland, the Zermatt air rescue team offers an insight into why millions of hikers, climbers and skiers visit the Swiss Alps every year, despite the risk of injury - or even death

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Between 1948 and 1960, governments around the world invested in electric tracks and diesel, but in Britain hundreds of steam-powered trains were built. This film looks at the reasons behind their continued production, and asks what happened to them

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Crewe to Crewe with Victoria Wood
programme.desc: Victoria Wood makes a round trip of northern England and Scotland starting at Crewe. She visits Carnforth Station, where David Lean shot the memorable location scenes in Brief Encounter, takes a sleeper train from Glasgow to Fort William and stops off at a railway museum in an enthusiasts back garden

programme.title: London to Brighton: Side By Side
programme.desc: In 1953, the BBC commissioned a recording filmed from the point-of-view of a London to Brighton train. In 1983, another film of the same journey was recorded. This short programme presents these two iconic recordings side-by-side, demonstrating how both locomotive technology and the landscape have evolved over the years

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland

programme.title: Phil Davis Remembers - The Firm
programme.desc: Phil Davis pays tribute to maverick film director Alan Clarke as he looks back on his time filming the 1989 drama, The Firm. He recalls how he was cast in the role of Yeti and how excited he was to work on this film about football hooliganism. Phil gets under the skin of the characters, explaining why they were attracted to mindless violence and how the cast all relished the opportunity to play these divisive roles and work with Clarke

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: Drama, starring Gary Oldman. An estate agent, with an apparently respectable family life, spends his weekends as the leader of a vicious firm of football hooligans who are planning a national assault on Europe. Co-starring Lesley Manville, Phil Davis and Charles Lawson. First broadcast 26 February 1989

programme.title: Why the Industrial Revolution Happened Here
programme.desc: Jeremy Black examines one of the most extraordinary periods in English history, explaining the unique economic, social and political conditions that led to the nation becoming the richest and most powerful on Earth by the 19th century. He traces the unprecedented explosion of new ideas and technological inventions that transformed an agrarian society into an increasingly industrial and urbanised one

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Between 1948 and 1960, governments around the world invested in electric tracks and diesel, but in Britain hundreds of steam-powered trains were built. This film looks at the reasons behind their continued production, and asks what happened to them

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland

programme.title: Britains Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri visit Brighton Museum to investigate who painted two neglected pictures of religious subjects. Plus, Emma investigates how Brightons Royal Pavilion ended up an empty shell, ransacked and sold to the local council

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: An ice pick found on the roof of a pub brings a murderer to justice and an anonymous letter informs police of a man who is storing and making guns

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is on home turf as she explores a property in Dundee. Dion Dublin visits a vast Merseyside house and Tommy Walsh loves the period features of a Plymouth property

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents further coverage of day four of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. The mens high jump final gets under way at 12.35, with Gianmarco Tamberi of Italy the reigning champion. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Mark Wright, Karla Pryce, Asher Edwards and a team of helping hands come to the aid of Darren and Lydia, whose one-bedroom flat has been taken over by their hobbies of baking and biking, leaving no space to relax or entertain. The team come up with some innovative solutions to saving space

programme.title: Robson Greens Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: BMX world champion and Olympic silver medal-winner Kieran Reilly heads to Northumberland for a weekend to relax, reset and recharge with Robson Green. The host is keen to show Kieran how he switches off - by fishing in the River Tyne

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a couple to find a new home closer to their son in Northumberland, and also pays a visit to the Northumberland National Park

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: James Broad and Lauren Wood visit a 300-year-old mill which has become a dumping ground for treasures and valuable heirlooms. The owners need to sell inherited items to fund the restoration of their home

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Stephen Mangan co-host the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoes fears continue to grow, despite Kat and Anthonys best efforts to reassure her. Worried shes putting everyone in danger, Zoe packs her belongings - but Stacey pleads with her to stay. Ravi is set on putting George out of action, so Harry enlists Kojos help to convince him to take Phils offer of a boxing tour. Ross takes on a second job, leaving Vicki to take on more responsibilities with Joel

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: The Less I Know About Joe, the Better
programme.desc: A glimpse into the daily lives of Stacey Solomon, Joe Swash and their five children. Stacey and Joe trade school runs for ski runs in a snowy family adventure, but Joes big romantic surprise quickly melts into laughter when it goes wrong

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.sub-title: The Great British Sewing Bee: The Final
programme.desc: Its sewing machines at the ready as the finalists tackle three challenges in their bid to be crowned this years winner. They begin by following the pattern for a deceptively simple bias-cut slip dress, where one mistake in cutting the fabric could cost them the chance to continue. In the transformation challenge, they make garments using sheer fabric, before finally tackling the art of trompe loeil, creating illusions with fabric to fit their chosen friend or family member. Three finalists, three challenges - but only one will be crowned as the latest champion. Presented by Sara Pascoe

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Red Eye
programme.desc: A hotel manager overcomes her fear of flying and boards a busy late-night flight to Miami, seating herself next to the seemingly friendly man she met in the airport. However, once the plane leaves the ground, she discovers her fellow passenger is a terrorist intent on involving her in an assassination plot. Wes Cravens suspense thriller, starring Rachel McAdams, Cillian Murphy and Brian Cox

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: A crate containing the couples mobile phones washes ashore, revealing more than anyone bargained for. David drops a bombshell to Ini, causing shockwaves at the Couples Cove. And when night falls, a movie serves up some even bigger surprises for the honeymooners. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A fingerprint on a fish and chips wrapper places a gunman in a rural location and police on a stakeout witness the shooting of their target. Plus, a fraudster uses victims credit details to buy gift cards at luxury shops until police track him down and find a plethora of evidence on his laptop

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An update on a new build in Staffordshire as it reaches it conclusion, plus visits to properties in south east London and Greater Manchester. Presented Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Ardingly, West Sussex, and learns about the ancient craft of batik. Experts Kate Bliss and Gary Pe help the teams to find a bargain

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents further coverage of day five of the biennial event at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo, featuring the mens 1500m final at 2.20. Great Britains Josh Kerr claimed a stunning victory in this race two years ago, beating favourite Jakob Ingebrigtsen of Norway into second place, and Ingebrigtsen was eliminated in the heats this time around. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps an aspiring writer who wants to make a dramatic relocation from the frenetic bustle of east London to the rural idylls of Dumfries and Galloway in Scotland. With a budget of £300,000, he has his sights set on somewhere isolated that will inspire his creativity. Away from the houses, Alistair heads for the hills hoping to strike it lucky on a Scottish gold rush

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and JJ Chalmers are on the outskirts of Glasgow to visit Fred, who desperately needs their help after a recent diagnosis threw his life into uncertainty. Sorting through his items, they find valuable jewellery, scientific equipment and chairs, as well as more unusual equipment, including an unused 1950s toaster and some ice skates

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Vernon Kay present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey and Zoe stake out Gregs place. Vicki is furious to learn Joel has played truant from school to attend the podcast recording event, and she turns to Julie for help with his behaviour. Lauren feels guilty when Louies present doesnt arrive in time for his birthday. Cindy suggests Peter should move in to help with the children

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals begin with a trip to Chawton House in Hampshire, once owned by Jane Austens brother, and the setting today for a special lunch to celebrate the literary giants birth 250 years ago. Working in two teams, the contestants must cook up a lunchtime feast that suits the occasion and is worthy of an 80-strong guest list that includes house staff, members of the Jane Austen Society and the writers fifth great-niece

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The film show may be over but the raw emotions seem likely to continue long after. The couples split into two groups and head off for days out on separate islands - unaware that castaways, some of whom are all too familiar, plan to gatecrash their parties. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Girl Fight
programme.desc: Rachel McIlhagga prepares for a kickboxing bout in Dublin, hoping she can rebuild her self-belief after a brutal MMA loss. Chloe Crozier is training for the biggest bout of her career - her first title fight. Winning a title is an essential step towards a professional fighting career, so Chloe must win to keep her dream of turning professional alive. Mother-and-daughter fighters Niamh McNeill and Julie train together, chasing their dream of appearing on the same card before Niamh leaves for a new life in Australia

programme.title: MOTD: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the matchday one league phase fixtures, including Liverpool v Atletico Madrid at Anfield, Athletic Bilbao v Arsenal at San Mames and Tottenham Hotspur v Villarreal at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. Liverpool topped this stage last season, but were eliminated by eventual champions Paris Saint-Germain in the last 16. Arsenal reached the semi-finals before also falling to PSG and their north London neighbours Spurs qualified for this competition after winning last terms UEFA Europa League

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes host a celebrity special of the music-based quiz show. Matt Edmondson, Jeremiah Asiamah, Keith Brymer Jones, Sophie Duker, and Shane and Sheena Lynch must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs for the charity of their choice

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from day four of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Americas Grant Holloway and Faith Kipyegon of Kenya were hoping to be in contention to defend their title in the 110m hurdles and womens 1500m respectively

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Monk St Augustine struggles to introduce Christianity to Saxon England, diarist Samuel Pepys annoys the smartest men in Britain, and Joan of Arcs story is told

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the worlds most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the shows new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Pilot for the military drama about 18-year-old Molly Dawes, who is desperate not to turn out like her mother - pregnant with her sixth child - and layabout father. So the morning after a hard drinking session, she walks into an Army recruitment office and tentatively asks about a job in the forces. The next thing she knows, she is on a two-day assessment course to find out whether she is a suitable candidate for basic training, and although she finds it hard to settle, the examiners see her as a rough diamond. But does she have enough potential to make it through? Lacey Turner stars, with Kerry Godliman, Matthew McNulty, Sean Gallagher, Dan Black and Katherine Pearce

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Lacey Turner stars in this drama about an aimless young woman who finds a direction in life after joining the Army. Six months on from completing her initial training, Molly is deployed to Afghanistan as part of the Royal Army Medical Corps. She is thrilled to be joining the platoon for one of the last missions before the British Army withdraws from the country, but makes a bad first impression on the captain - and things only get worse when one of her fellow soldiers turns out to be a face from her past that she would rather forget (played by Game of Thrones and Misfits star Iwan Rheon). The cast also includes Ben Aldridge, Arinze Kene and Ade Oyefeso, with Kerry Godliman and Sean Gallagher as Mollys parents

programme.title: Bram Stokers Dracula
programme.desc: A 15th-century Transylvanian knight becomes a vampire after the death of his beloved wife. Centuries later, he learns she has been reincarnated, and travels to Victorian London with the intent of seducing her into joining him in living death. Francis Ford Coppolas Gothic horror based on the novel, starring Gary Oldman, Winona Ryder, Anthony Hopkins and Keanu Reeves

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the worlds most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the shows new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: In Conversation
programme.desc: Rina Sawayama has been called the future of queer pop music. The Japanese-British singer speaks to the BBCs gender and identity correspondent Megha Mohan about her frustrations with the music industry, how her sexuality informs her art and growing up with racism in the UK. She also reveals, for the first time, the deeply personal and devastating inspiration behind her album

programme.title: We Built a Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary following 19-year-old TikTok star Kyle Thomas as he attempts to build a zoo for exotic species and separate himself from past controversy with animal rights activists. He enlists the help of farmer and builder Phil Hughes and together the pair plan on turning Phils modest petting farm into a world-class sanctuary for unwanted exotic animals

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from day five of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Great Britains Josh Kerr was looking to retain the 1500m title he won two years ago in Budapest, and his compatriot Molly Caudery was hoping to be in contention in the womens pole vault

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Queen Victorias coronation fails to go according to plan, George IV takes part in Historical Come Dine with Me, and Alexander the Great refuses to stop conquering things

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Manchester and discovers one of the most dilapidated clubs he has ever seen, with a clubhouse that is almost derelict and not enough players for even one team. He sets himself a deadline to get it back up and running by the end of the summer. In Blackpool, the girls team suffers a crisis of confidence when Freddie introduces the hard ball to training, then to make matters worse, theres a divide in the team

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: The Less I Know About Joe, the Better
programme.desc: A glimpse into the daily lives of Stacey Solomon, Joe Swash and their five children. Stacey and Joe trade school runs for ski runs in a snowy family adventure, but Joes big romantic surprise quickly melts into laughter when it goes wrong

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Molly seems to be settling into life in Afghanistan with surprising ease, as she even strikes up a rapport with a little girl named Bashira. However, not everyone is convinced their bond is a good thing, as Captain James advises the medic against becoming too involved with the locals. His words cause Molly to question Bashiras motives for befriending her, but when the youngster lets slip some vital information about the insurgency, the entire platoon has no choice but to embark on a potentially explosive mission. It looks as if Captain Jamess warning could come back to haunt Molly as she realises shes placed her own life and that of Bashira in danger. Lacey Turner, Ben Aldridge and Iwan Rheon star

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Molly and Smurf return to the UK for rest leave, but with their comrades facing a big threat in Afghanistan, they find it hard to switch off and settle into life back home. As Molly finds Smurf is the only one who understands how she feels, their friendship eventually deepens into something more serious - but then he makes a declaration that could ruin everything. Before long, they are back in the field, where Molly comes under threat from an old enemy. Military drama, starring Lacey Turner and Iwan Rheon

programme.title: Words on Bathroom Walls
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate, who inspires him to not be defined by his condition. Romantic drama, starring Charlie Plummer, Andy Garcia and Taylor Russell

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers the dark side of Thailands backpacker culture. In the first episode, she lands in trouble with the Thai police when she starts to uncover the scale of Thailands illegal sex industry. A visit to the Bangkok Immigration Detention Centre exposes how easy it is to get caught on the wrong side of the law

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets men chasing cheap thrills in Asias sex capital, Pattaya, and also talks to a local sex worker, who reveals the harsh reality of working in the illegal sex industry. She then heads to Ko Phangan, an exotic island famed for its spirituality and beauty. For Zara, this is paradise - but Lucio, a Brit who built a burgeoning cannabis business here while the drug was decriminalised, reveals that navigating the local law isnt always easy

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott experiences Ko Phangans famous Full Moon Party, but beneath the cheap cocktails, music and fire shows, theres danger lurking as the medical team treat a possible drink-spiking victim. She then travels to Phuket and experiences a taste of Thailands luxury lifestyle. But she also learns how dream holidays can quickly go wrong, hearing the case of a British holiday-maker who died on the island - and whose family is still searching for answers

programme.desc: Mush-Mush invents a new game called Fruity Bounce. / When Mush-Mush discovers that Morel is afraid of the dark, he suggests that Chep, Lilit and he take the Mushlets to their first overnight forest camp / Because Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit are always up to new adventures, Bolly has dubbed them The Adventurers. / Truff is happy. He has found a necklace that makes him even Truffier! Except he had no idea the necklace belongs to Starmush.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Show Mush Go On/Mushpots Treasure/Mush-Mush The Predictor/Whos Eating Mushton
programme.desc: Mushpie loves to sing. Only problem she is terrible at it! But Lilit, who has never heard her sing before, wants to make Mushpie happy and organizes a concert for her to sing. / When Mushpot wishes he could roll back the seasons and relive being a Mushler, our friends get him to hang out doing cool Mushler stuff. / Mush-Mush can’t figure out why his sense foot keeps buzzing like crazy… until an earthquake shakes the forest. Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Work Like a Charm/Star Helpers/The Rollinator/Save The Fun Tree
programme.desc: Chep becomes obsessed with learning all about Mushlore – all the funny little traditions and things that Mushables believe in. / Starmush’s back is stuck, and the Mushelder has no choice but to ask for help in Mushton. / Chep is so good at moss-marbles, no one wants to play him anymore! No one except Sumush who reveals himself to be a tough competitor. / Mush-Mush and friends’ favourite play tree is rotten and doomed. Our friends, track down Starmush, hoping his powers can save it.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Puffs Perfect Picnic/Run, Mushpie, Run/Watch the Storm/Lightning Bark/Special Delivery/The Perfect Fritter
programme.desc: Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / When Chep asks Mush-Mush and Lilit to go storm-watching and they refuse, Lilit feels bad and convinces Mush-Mush to join their friend. / Fung and Miff have come across a rare piece of bark struck by lightning. / Chep knows so many things about nature that Mush-Mush and Lilit are confident he’s not far from being an expert like Mushpot. / Sushi-Mushi tests new compost fritters recipes. When Mush-Mush gets to taste one, he can’t believe it: Sushi-Mushi has cooked the perfect fritter.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: The Bear and the Butterfly/Get Off My Tennis...
programme.desc: ...Shoes/Babysitting/Bear Under Lock And Key/Lemming Blues/Snow Lemmings/Augmented Bear/Lemmings Under Pressure/Lemmings in Space => Grizzy wants to offer a butterfly to his beloved she bear. / The Lemmings have discovered an addictive new game based on the astonishing bouncing properties of the rangers new running shoes. / Grizzy babysits for the she-bear he has a crush on. Theres no question of Grizzy tripping up, for he has no intention of taking any risks! / Unwilling to share the food both he and the Lemmings are wild about, Grizzy locks it up inside the ranger’s brand new and apparently burglar proof safe. / Grizzy is impressed by the TV show of a magician who transforms a partridge into a bouquet of flowers. / On a very hot day an ice cream commercial awakes the desire of Grizzy. / The Lemmings have discovered a truly wild new game: an augmented reality program on the rangers digital tablet. / The only edible food item left in the rangers cabin is a gorgeous salmon which is stuck inside a block of ice at the back of the freezer compartment. / The Lemmings have unearthed a box filled with birthday fountains of light that spit forth giant bursts of sparks.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: A Frog Of A Problem/Fool The Forest/Mushroomates/Race The Beast/Surprise, Its Spring
programme.desc: Mush-Mush’s favourite frog has had its home taken over by a lizard. Mushpot says not to interfere – nature will balance itself out. / It’s Fool the Forest Day! Mushables pull pranks all over Mushton, and Mush-Mush has an epic one planned. / When ants invade Fung and Miff’s tree, our Mushlers offer for them to move in… but the two quickly turn out to be unbearable roommates. / Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Mysterious Seepod/A day with Starmush/Dare for more/Compost to Go
programme.desc: Chep has come across a new seedpod specimen. Mushpot warns him not to take it though. / Mush-Mush wants to be just like Starmush when he grows up, because he’s convinced that Starmush is the most awesome Mushable there is. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit are playing dares and having a lot fun. All the Mushables are happy for them except Fung and Miff who keep mocking them. / When Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit take their compost meals back to their home-tree to eat, they think they have made a great new discovery.

programme.title: Moley
programme.sub-title: Molerskating Mayhem/Duck Moley Duck!/Squirm’s Day Out/Three Gentlemen of Moletown/Who Arted
programme.desc: Moley must learn to Molerskate for the Great Mole Roll skating competition and discovers his parents have a hidden talent. / When an egg rolls into Moletown and a duckling hatches, Moley must play momma to the baby duck until they can find its home. / When Moley helps take care of the worms at Dotty’s Adopt a Worm Rescue Center, the Gardener sends Squirm to pose as a homeless worm and help him steal Manny. / When Moley’s Keeper duties are pulling him in too many directions, he gets Manny to create multiple Moleys! / When Dotty joins an art competition Moley is afraid her art won’t appeal to the snooty judge so he casts a spell that causes her art to come to life!

The idea of breaking a papier-mâche statue with a bat like it says in the instructions pleases him. / Inside a mysterious cave Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a magical Game of the Goose. / Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove. / Grizzy discovers the leftovers of a Halloween party in the rangers cabin which was entirely redecorated for the occasion. / Grizzy wants to give the she-bear hes in love with a plastic ring which he finds really swell. / Grizzy finds a strange figurine with the power to switch the spirits of two living beings and finds himself imprisoned in the body of a caribou.

programme.sub-title: The Nest/The Points/The Bus/The Night/The Misunderstandings/The Roots/The Blame/The Slap
programme.desc: Elmore residents are going missing, and the cause of these disappearances may be closer to home than Gumball and Darwin think. / Gumball and Darwin agree to do all of Tobiass chores, in exchange for good points! / When Rocky suggests that the Elmore Junior High kids skip school the bus is boarded by criminals who seem to want to teach them the importance of school attendance. / Ever wondered what the people of Elmore dream about? As night falls in Elmore the Moon takes us on a tour through the various dreams - and nightmares - of the inhabitants. / Gumball is late to meet Penny at the mall, but a series of misunderstandings on the way only delay him further. / When Mom sees Darwin gazing longingly at a fish-tank she thinks their mammalian lifestyle isn’t fulfilling her adopted son and deep down he longs to connect with his fishy roots. / The Parent Teacher Association of Elmore Junior High bans video games, so the kids try and prove that games arent a bad influence. / Tobias follows every single high-five with a butt-slap so when Gumball doesn’t get one he feels insulted. programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula play a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fair, and they throw them into the air to see how high they can fly

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say s, and we go on an adventure around the sound. We play on a seesaw, eat some sausages and meet a singing seal! The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dees friend finally succeeds in saying todays letter sound.

programme.title: Lu and the Bally Bunch
programme.desc: Lu learns that she cant be upset with someone for doing something she has also done

programme.title: Piggy Builders
programme.desc: The full moon makes Wilf howl all night. The next morning, everyone is exhausted - and theres a boulder blocking Brians door

programme.title: Twirlywoos

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends fly a hawk, and Mr Tumble takes a flight on an aeroplane

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies do conga dances over the hills, then they conga into Home Dome to answer the Tubby Phone and do a special conga Tubby Phone Dance. In Tummy Tales, children have lots of fun as they conga around a soft play centre

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome Zuri, Otis, Theo, Reau, Elijah and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Giovanna has a tambourine inside her bag. All the parents and babies have different noisy objects and toys in their bags too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are encouraged to hide baby-appropriate noisy toys and objects inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, and then play with the items together! The fun childrens song Noisy Noisy Shaker features, as does a story about Baby Bear and Baby Tiger making lots of noise, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring sounds too. The Baby Bear Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory lights and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: Kiri and Lou
programme.desc: Kiri and Lou gather Yum Yum Baronies on Nonsense Day.

programme.title: Maddie and Triggs
programme.desc: Maddie and Triggs get creative as they try to remove a buzzy fly from their bedroom

programme.title: Dylans Playtime Adventures
programme.desc: Dylan the supermarket worker wants to sell everything his customers want. But when they all demand a product he only has one of, he needs to get creative!

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Welcome to Vegesaur Valley, home to the juiciest and crunchiest creatures ever to rule the planet - the mighty Vegesaurs

programme.title: Bluey
programme.sub-title: Bumpy and the Wise Old Wolfhound
programme.desc: Bingo is sick in hospital, so Bluey and Dad send her a homemade video to lift her spirits. It tells the tale of Barnicus quest to heal her spotty dog named Bumpy

programme.title: Hey Duggees Squirrel Club

programme.title: Roots and Fruits

programme.title: Timmy Time

programme.title: Time for School

programme.title: Big Cook Little Cook
programme.desc: Childrens cookery series with Big Cook Jen and Little Cook Small. Small wants to be the first at everything in the cafe, including greeting todays customer Bounce the Bunny. Jen and Small decide to make Bounce a rabbity carrot cake.

programme.title: Aneeshwar and Lizzie Go Wild

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Five and friends discover a hole that makes their heads fall off. Learn how to count up and down and how to add to five with the Numberblocks

programme.title: Alphablocks

programme.title: Bluey

programme.desc: Joe spends the night in Daphnes room, causing a shocked Frasiers mind to work overtime and Niles to become consumed by jealousy. Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce star

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village

For the showstopper, they serve up sweet bread in tiers. Sadly, for one baker, this will be their last day in the tent. Who will be dusting themselves off and hanging up their apron?

programme.title: The Inheritance

programme.title: The Fear Clinic: Face Your Phobia

Paula inherited her phobia from her mum and recalls being trapped in her bedroom for fear of a spider. Chloe has emetophobia - the phobia of people being sick - and talks about her sadness at not being able to care for her three young daughters. Chloes eldest daughter is already starting to show signs of the same phobia, after seeing Chloes reaction. Millys had a phobia of frogs for as long as she remembers. She wants to be treated for her phobia before her two young children inherit it too

The second episode focuses on President Trump as he pursues an ambitious agenda to transform America. Hes learned his lessons from his first term and seems not to be allowing anyone or anything to get in his way, breaking with the democratic norms the country was founded on. As he takes on the media, the press and the universities while ensuring that he keeps US borders secure, Trumps sends the National Guard to Los Angeles and Washington DC

programme.title: Trump v The Truth
programme.desc: One of the characteristics of both of Donald Trumps presidential terms is his disconnection from truth. To coincide with his second state visit to the UK, over several hours, Channel 4 examines a series of President Trumps statements that are untrue. Drawn from interviews, social media, press conferences and speeches from the last eight months, each false claim will be followed by an analysis of the claim. The false claims might include misleading pronouncements, sweeping assertions without evidence, baseless claims, factual inaccuracies, and the sharing of fake or untrue social media posts

programme.title: Surgeons: A Matter of Life or Death
programme.desc: Dan, 37, faces one of the hardest waits of his life. Diagnosed with primary sclerosing cholangitis - a disease that is causing his bile ducts and liver to fail - his only chance of survival is a liver transplant. A potential donor has been found, and now the race is on to assess the livers viability. Once in surgery, Mr Bartlett works against the clock to quickly remove the old, diseased liver. But while trying to restore the blood supply to the new organ, theres a worrying lack of blood pressure

programme.title: Brunel: The Man Who Built Britain
programme.desc: Rob Bell tells the story of Isambard Kingdom Brunels two masterpieces of ship design - the SS Great Britain, the great-great-grandmother of all modern ships, and the SS Great Eastern. By the time he had finalised the latters design, the ship was 692ft long and weighed nearly 19,000 tons. The biggest vessel afloat of its era, it dominated the final years of Brunels life, generating great controversy at the time. It has even been blamed for causing his death

Meanwhile, 35-year-old Sophie from York seeks a man who isnt going to mess her around

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Best friends Emma and Dani hope that going on a double date will double their chances of leaving with the one for them. Emma is matched with wildlife documentary filmmaker Joe while Dani is paired with construction worker Clinton but the girls start to wonder if they should swap partners. Factory worker Mark is hoping Venezuelan cleaner Aire will be his perfect salsa partner and DJ Mel goes on a date with fashion graduate Samira

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: Fraser deals with escalating tension between two of his stewards that threatens to ruin his season. Jared makes a big mistake, which makes Ben and Fraser worry that they cant rely on the new bosun. Captain Kerry docks St David for the first time, but the deck teams lack of communication threatens to lead to a disastrous end to the first charter

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A House for Sale and Serious Woman Stuff
programme.desc: When Sheldon learns the house next door is for sale, the eccentric youngster takes it upon himself to find the perfect neighbours. Missy is left feeling torn when forced to pitch against her boyfriend at the baseball game. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Zoe Perry

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Baby Tooth and the Egyptian God of Knowledge
programme.desc: The eccentric youngster makes a scientific breakthrough at the dentists office. Dale and Meemaw go to the casino and Georgie makes a big mistake when he is left in charge of the store. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire struggles to find the right moment to sack an employee, while Phil catches Luke in a compromising position at home and everyone fails to notice that Alex has moved back for the summer. Elsewhere, Jay refuses to accept that finding a job again might be harder than he thought and Lily gets caught in the middle when Cameron and Mitch decide to spend the summer apart

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Leela worries about Ste when he doesnt come home, while Dillon jumps to conclusions. Elsewhere, Jez plans a memorial for Sienna

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: There is a shocking discovery in a missing persons case, Tom helps Tony to adapt to prison life, and a resident gets backed into a corner

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos featuring sheep

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits PJs Steakhouse in Queens, New York, to provide his expert advice to the owners. They decided to turn a successful bar into a high-end restaurant, but without any previous experience in managing a business they found themselves seriously in debt. With an over-confident chef and a partner propping up the bar, co-owner Madalyn faces a few difficult decisions

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: When plans for an outing to the Frying Dutchman are ruined, the family tries to salvage the night by recounting three stories about disasters at sea. One of the tales told is about a fugitive called Homer who delivered the Mayflower safely to the New World

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Girls Just Want to Have Sums
programme.desc: A scandal results in Principal Skinner being replaced by a woman who divides the school in half according to gender, so Lisa poses as a boy to attend maths classes. However, it is not long before she comes to the attention of Bart - who sees through her disguise. With the voice of Frances McDormand

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Secret Letter and a Lowly Disc of Processed Meat
programme.desc: The eccentric youngster discovers that Mary has been keeping a secret about his future. Meemaw is furious when she learns Dale fired Georgie

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: After graduating high school, Sheldon has a breakdown when he realises he may not be ready for college. Dale tries to make amends with Meemaw. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is disappointed with Sheldon when he announces he is breaking his promise to go with her to a birthday party in favour of joining the boys for a Star Wars video-game marathon. Comedy, starring Mayim Bialik and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some Star Trek action figures, but the duo refuse to remove them from the packaging in case their value is diminished. Elsewhere, Raj is desperate to find someone to accompany him to a wedding and asks his parents to find him a date. Featuring the guest voice of Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The families prepare to woo their significant others on Valentines Day. Claire plans a special, romantic getaway with Phil, and Jay decides to treat Gloria to a stand-up show. Meanwhile, Cam and Mitchell play Cupid for Manny to end his quest for a date

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Luke spend father-son time together searching for hidden treasures beneath the house, Mitch and Cam cause embarrassment by inviting Lilys paediatrician to lunch, and Haley takes her driving test

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Amy and Wil Wheaton get into a fight while filming Fun with Flags, Sheldon suffers the consequences of their fall-out. He ends up going to Penny for advice and after getting drunk, confronts the actor in a bid to make him apologise. Bernadette encourages Howard to move out of his mothers house

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldons post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pairs friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As part of the relationship agreement, Sheldon reluctantly has to take care of Amy when she gets sick, but she loves the extra attention so much she pretends to remain in poor health. Elsewhere, Howard tries to get some tips on manliness from Penny when he and Bernadette go to visit her father

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta goes to extremes trying to impress Santiagos father at Thanksgiving dinner. Boyle is on turkey duty, and Holt helps Pimento deal with no longer being able to work for the NYPD

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When a famous author receives death threats, Peralta and Jeffords take the case so that Jeffords can meet his lifelong hero. Gina wants to choose the location of the annual Boyle family vacation, and Santiago gets in the middle of a fight between Captain Holt and Kevin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns wins a professional basketball team in a poker game at the annual billionaires retreat. He decides to build a state-of-the-art stadium in an effort to lure fans, but the proposed site is on the last remaining bee colony in Springfield - prompting Lisa to lead a protest

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa lets her imagination run wild when she makes a new friend and they create a magical kingdom together called Equalia, complete with characters and plotlines. But they find themselves facing a nightmare when the boundaries between reality and fantasy become blurred. With the voice of Emily Blunt

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends compete in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj to test their scientific knowledge and life skills, but the game brings out the best and worst in everyone. As the hunt progresses, Howard and Amy begin to bond over their shared musical tastes, while Penny and Sheldon work together as a team and Bernadette becomes fiercely competitive

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Meanwhile, Leonard realises he can manipulate Penny into feeling sorry for him when his mother publishes a reveal-all book about his childhood problems. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon re-evaluates the time he spends with Amy when she takes a job at the university. Meanwhile, Howard is forced to sleep on his friends sofa after he gets into an argument with Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart sets out to save Homer from the embarrassing effects of his latest misfortune, and does so well he becomes convinced he possesses miraculous healing powers. Featuring the guest voice of Don Cheadle (Iron Man 2)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns asks the family to look after his mansion while he books himself into a clinic for a complete check-up - but with Homer in charge, things are hardly likely to run smoothly. Featuring the guest voice of Britney Spears

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tony feels disheartened behind bars, but will the return of a familiar face help? Meanwhile, a secret becomes too heavy for one resident to hold

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: El Viaje Misterioso de Nuestro Jomer (The Mysterious Voyage of Our Homer)
programme.desc: An overdose of spicy Mexican food at the local chilli festival causes Homer to experience a series of hallucinations that inspire him to set out in search of his true soulmate. Featuring the guest voice of Johnny Cash as a talking coyote

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Twenty seven-year-old single mother and dog groomer Brenna seeks a man who wont be put off by the fact she has a daughter. She hopes to find a connection with dog-loving electrician Ross. Twenty-four-year-old party girl Tori is looking for someone to bring a bit of sparkle into her life. Shes matched with 30-year-old beautician Sophie, whos on the lookout for a life partner. Plus, actress Alice meets 26-year-old cocktail bartender Jac, who is hoping to shake his life up a bit

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated viewers the Siddiquis, Giles and Mary, Jenny and Lee, Ellie and Izzi, Mary and Marina, and Amira and Iqra look back on 2020s biggest and best shows, including Strictly Come Dancing, Countdown, This Morning, Yorkshire Tea vs PG Tips: Battle of the Brews, Nigellas Cook, Eat, Repeat, CBeebies Bedtime Stories, The Undoing, First Dates, Borat Subsequent Moviefilm, Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, Elephant, The Great British Bake Off, The Crown and Naked Attraction

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Sixty-three-year-old Jean, a French teacher and avid reader, is looking for someone to match her intellect. Enter 65-year-old crime fiction writer Andy, theyre both eager to find love later in life after overcoming obstacles. Plus, trainee barrister Holly, whos 28, is matched with 26-year-old artist Marcella

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: A 23-year-old virgin from Kent picks a partner from six nude candidates - but this proves a nerve-racking experience, since he has never seen a naked woman in his life. Meanwhile, a 27-year-old beauty therapist from London is determined to have a baby before she turns 30, and hopes that one of the men lurking behind the screens will be the perfect father

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A corporation buys Springfield Elementary School so it can secretly use the pupils as guinea pigs to test a new range of toys - but Lisa is not fooled and sets out to stop the businessmen. With the guest voices of Tim Robbins, Joe Mantegna and Gary Coleman

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated viewers the Siddiquis, Giles and Mary, Jenny and Lee, Ellie and Izzi, Mary and Marina, and Amira and Iqra look back on 2020s biggest and best shows, including Strictly Come Dancing, Countdown, This Morning, Yorkshire Tea vs PG Tips: Battle of the Brews, Nigellas Cook, Eat, Repeat, CBeebies Bedtime Stories, The Undoing, First Dates, Borat Subsequent Moviefilm, Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, Elephant, The Great British Bake Off, The Crown and Naked Attraction

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: After learning some heartbreaking information about Cat, Fraser urges Barbie to be kinder to her, which ignites a new feud between Barbie and Fraser. programme.title: The Devil at 4 OClock
programme.desc: A priest is sent to a South Seas island to replace a drunken missionary, who has been relieved of his duties. Sharing his flight are three convicts being sent to work at a childrens leper hospital. The five men must work together to protect the young patients when a volcano erupts, leaving them stranded with no easy way out. Adventure, starring Spencer Tracy, Frank Sinatra and Kerwin Mathews

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis Wain: Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpes eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: The father of a Navy cadet accused of theft goes to great lengths to restore his sons tarnished reputation. Historical courtroom drama based on a play by Terence Rattigan, starring Robert Donat, Margaret Leighton, Cedric Hardwicke and Basil Radford.

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis Wain: Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpes eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain

programme.title: How Green Was My Valley
programme.desc: Residents of a Welsh mining community at the start of the 20th century struggle to come to terms with the decline in their traditional way of life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Walter Pidgeon, Maureen OHara, Donald Crisp and Roddy McDowall

programme.title: Instant Family
programme.desc: After being taunted by relatives who think they will never have kids, married couple Pete and Ellie Wagner consider the option of adopting a child. However, they get more than they bargained for when they take in a rebellious teen and her two siblings. Director Sean Anders comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg, Rose Byrne and Isabela Merced

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis Wain: Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpes eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain

programme.title: Elizabeth
programme.desc: Elizabeth I rises to the throne of a divided and troubled Britain, and the early years of her reign find her under pressure to marry and produce an heir - while enemies both overseas and within her own court plot to bring about her downfall. Shekhar Kapurs historical drama, starring Cate Blanchett, Geoffrey Rush, Christopher Eccleston and Joseph Fiennes

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane visits Los Angeles to see his family over the Christmas holiday. Stopping off at his wifes place of work, he realises armed men have taken over the building and are holding the corporations staff to ransom - and only he has the ability to fight back. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman and Bonnie Bedelia

programme.title: Meander
programme.desc: A woman finds herself locked in a series of strange tunnels full of deadly traps. She has no choice but to crawl into safe sections to survive. To know why shes there and how to get out, she will have to face the memories of her dead daughter. Horror, starring Gaia Weiss, Peter Franzen and Romane Libert. In French and English

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: Oscar-winning Second World War biopic of the American general admired for his brilliant tactical skills and ability to inspire his men to great things. But this complex man was equally noted for his abrasive temper, egotism and consuming sense of rivalry, which so antagonised his superiors he was eventually relieved of his command. Starring George C Scott, Karl Malden, Michael Bates and Stephen Young

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: A Belgian priest living in exile in Britain during the Second World War becomes a secret agent for the Allies, but his first mission is a disaster, leading to the capture of a resistance leader. Four soldiers are sent into occupied France to rescue the insurgent, but begin to realise they have a traitor in their midst. Thriller, starring Jack Warner and Simone Signoret

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villains cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: A retired school teacher whose husband has recently died longs to experience the passion that was missing in her marriage. She resolves to get a crash course in pleasure by hiring a charming young sex worker. Comedy drama, starring Emma Thompson and Daryl McCormack

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: Film assistant Manuel Torres yearns to rise through the ranks in 1920s Hollywood, starting with a lowly position working for matinee idol Jack Conrad. Manny is smitten with ingenue Nellie LaRoy, who intends to achieve big screen fame. Their fates entwine with a motley crew of wannabes and hangers on. Writer/director Damien Chazelles comedy drama, starring Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie and Diego Calva

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: A gunslinger rides into a backwoods town intent on finding his dead wifes former lover and exacting revenge for her death. The man he blames now has total control of the town and has the sheriff at his beck and call. Undeterred, the drifter offers his enemy an ultimatum - he has until sundown to leave the town or face retribution for his crimes. Western, with Randolph Scott, John Carroll and Andrew Duggan

programme.desc: Eighteen years after vanishing from a holiday apartment in Praia da Luz, Portugal, the mystery of Madeleine McCanns disappearance remains unsolved. German prosecutors recently confirmed that Christian Brueckner, the man theyve long believed responsible, is set to be released from prison with no charges imminent in relation to Madeleines abduction and suspected murder. Criminologist Dr Graham Hill, a former senior Met detective who was in Portugal during the early stages of the investigation, returns to Praia da Luz. He examines the case against the man who remains the prime suspect, and who has consistently denied any involvement in Madeleines disappearance

programme.title: Billie and Greg: The Family Diaries
programme.desc: The Shepherds enjoy their last few days in paradise. Margot hits a major milestone as she tries her first solid food and Greg gets an exciting call from his agent

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Perdy tells Grayson that Rosemary lied about his fathers death, before violently attacking her mother-in-law. Terry knocks Duke to the ground during an argument.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matthew tells Perdy the only way to escape hospital and get her life back is to pretend shes ill, while Andy is persuaded to give the goats a stay of execution.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Paul struggles to keep his mouth shut about his unexpected encounter with Leanne, while Ken sets off to meet Daniel - unaware hes being followed by Blanche - and Liz sets up a secret rendezvous with Derek.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Paul urges Liam to get rid of Leanne, so she hits back with a threat to the factory boss - if he says any more, shell tell Carla what he was up to the night before.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Since calling off his marriage to Louisa, Martin has begun to question what keeps him in Cornwall and realises that if he is ever to escape, he must conquer the blood phobia that ended his surgical career. Encouraged by aunt Joans friend Barbara he tackles his fear, but after an accident the pair end up in hospital, where he bumps into his girlfriend from medical school. Later, the return of a familiar face shakes him up even more. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Stephanie Cole and Lia Williams

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Despite the doctors unpleasant attitude toward her, Louisa applies for a job at the school - where she quickly notices something strange about the new headmasters behaviour. Martin refers Paulines aunt and uncle to Edith after they have trouble conceiving a baby, but her tests lead one of the couple to make a surprising confession. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with David Haig

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Nigel Harper prepares for the arrival of an important patient, who proves useful when an injured teenager is brought in. Lizzie comes to terms with her husbands recent behaviour. Medical drama following the staff and patients at a hospital in Sixties Yorkshire, starring John Axon, Linda Armstrong and Michelle Hardwick

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A couple who have recently returned to Aidensfield from Africa accuse their housekeeper of stealing, but Blaketon is more concerned about protecting their son from bullies. Meanwhile, Greengrass has a porker of a problem on his hands thanks to David, who accidentally buys some pigs at an auction on his behalf. Rural drama, with Bill Maynard and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie refuses to believe her uncle could be responsible for a hit-and-run incident, despite the weight of evidence against him - a situation which puts her relationship with Mike to the test. Elsewhere, life in Aidensfield carries on much as normal, as Greengrasss greed causes a funeral to be a total wash-out. Rural drama, with Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paul begins to realise the extent of his feelings for Grayson, while Marlon fears the truth about the robbery will come out when he learns of Elis involvement with Debbie.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paul tries to stifle his feelings for Grayson. Diane struggles to put Billy behind her, and Marlon catches Eli smuggling stolen goods into the house.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Deirdre is furious when she discovers Ken spent the night at Denises, and wastes no time making her feelings known. Pauls hopes of avoiding Leanne are dashed when Carla invites her to dinner

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Denise attempts to put things straight between Ken and Deirdre - but all she achieves is a massive three-way argument in the Rovers. Fiz goes on a trip down memory lane with an old flame

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: PC Penhale is delighted by the arrival of his older brother Sam, but their reunion turns to misery when Martin delivers bad news to one of them. Louisa searches for a new home in the village and visits Edith for a check-up, where she reveals an embarrassing piece of information, and Al makes his situation with Pauline worse by trying to act on advice from Bert. Starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Al tries to raise some quick cash, and offers to sort out all Louisas household and plumbing problems if she can pay him promptly. The teacher gets good news on the employment front, and Martin accidentally inflicts a minor wound on an elderly patient - who responds by walking out of the surgery and vowing never to return. Drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with Phyllida Law and Benjamin Whitrow

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina helps an old flame who goes AWOL from the Army and David ends up with more than egg on his face when Greengrass arranges a gourmet dinner at the pub. Nostalgic drama, starring Tricia Penrose and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The residents of Aidensfield find themselves in the grip of a flu epidemic, putting baby Sam at risk. Meanwhile, Greengrass grudgingly finds himself helping the police retrieve an old friends stolen property, and Blaketons interference in the running of the pub drives Gina up the wall. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morses investigation into a number of untimely death notices in the Oxford Mail, each with a cryptic message, takes him to a series of funerals before forcing him to confront his own mortality. Thursday is facing more than one confrontation of his own as his past closes in on him, while he resorts to desperate measures to protect those he loves most. Final episode of the Inspector Morse prequel, starring Shaun Evans and Roger Allam

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: An elderly woman is found dead in her flat after a break-in, leading Ronnie and Sam to suspect a burglary gone wrong. However, following a tip-off from the victims grand-daughter Connie, the detectives attention turns to live-in carer Cecile, who is promptly arrested. But the accused points the finger back at Connie, claiming she had been deliberately starving her grandmother. Who will the team believe? With Jan Francis, Daniel Casey and Ramon Tikaram

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Following the brutal murder of a gay man, Sam and Ronnie embark on a desperate mission to track down the victims adoptive son, who has gone missing. The prime suspect soon emerges as the childs biological father - an alleged violent homophobe unable to stomach the idea of the youngster being brought up in a same-sex household - but was he acting alone? Guest starring Glynis Barber, with Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Return of the detective drama starring Bradley Walsh. Ronnie and new partner Joe lead the investigation into the death of jeweller Harry Bernstein, who has been found with his hands and teeth missing. His wife, her lover and a former business associate are all possible suspects, but the case takes a surprising turn when the victims sister receives a gruesome delivery. Shes on the jury for the trial of a drug dealer and murderer who Ronnie has been trying to nail for years, and the threat to her points to jury tampering, so Jake and Kate have to take a dramatic approach to win the case. The problem is, theyre up against a formidable defence barrister. Co-starring Ben Bailey Smith, Dominic Rowan and Georgia Taylor, with guests Helen Baxendale and Christopher Fulford

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie begin the fight to keep Theo, but its an expensive and painful process and the constant dredging up of their past starts to damage their relationship. Can they survive? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.desc: Donnas suspicions put Eli in the frame as the man who shot Marlon. Rosemary continues to try to unite Katie and Grayson, while Jos farm tours get off to a flying start.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon comes clean to Donna about his role in the robbery. Laurel gets amorous in a desperate bid to induce her baby, while Billy accuses Diane of trying to split him and Val up.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ken moves in with Denise and announces he wont be in touch with Deirdre unless she apologises. Michelle tells Steve a secret about Paul after hearing about their high-stakes round of golf

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve and Michelle are caught kissing - but Liz isnt too happy about the blossoming relationship - while Blanche plays match-maker when Ken comes to collect more things.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Pauline finds out about Martins imminent departure to London and confronts him over her uncertain future. Aunt Joan tries to solve her farms money problems by opening a BandB - and ends up having to call the doctor for her first guest, local farmer Ted. Elsewhere, Bert organises a baby shower for Louisa. David Ross (The Green Green Grass) guest stars, with Martin Clunes, Stephanie Cole and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor spends his last day in Portwenn seeing an influx of patients as he prepares to close down the surgery and move to London. As he bids farewell to old friends and sets off to leave the village, he sees Louisas teaching assistant Tasha fall from the Harbour Day stage and stops to help. But the bigger hold-up comes when pregnant Louisa is involved in a car accident. Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass meets his match in a gang of loutish Liverpudlians, and the Aidensfield bobbies investigate a case worthy of Agatha Christie, involving an old woman found dead in a mysterious house. Meanwhile, behind the scenes, Craddock makes a shock announcement to Ventress. Bill Maynard, William Simons and Philip Franks star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress tries to discover why an old foe has returned to Aidensfield, and Greengrass makes a touching promise to a dying friend - but has a fight on his hands keeping it. Meanwhile, Maggie is concerned about a girl who wants an abortion. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when the body of a wildlife ranger is found on a remote island off the coast of Northumberland. Her death is at first assumed to be an accident, since she was alone on the island when she died, but marks on the body seem to point to murder. As Vera delves into the dead womans personal life, she uncovers dark secrets and old resentments

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: While investigating the fatal stabbing of a psychiatrist with a caseload of violent adolescent patients, Ronnie and Joes first instinct is to question those he was treating. However, the case takes a disturbing turn when the detectives discover a hidden sleeping compartment in the victims office which has clearly been used recently by one of his underage visitors - and evidence comes to light suggesting he may have been having an affair with one of them. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, with Ramon Tikaram and Hattie Morahan

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: While working with the drug squad, Ronnie and Joe find a skeleton that has been hidden inside the boot of a car in the River Thames. It turns out to be the remains of Taylor Kane, an undercover policeman who went missing in the 1980s - around the time of the Brixton riots. Through clever detection, unsettling evidence is unearthed and the team knows it must raise issues the police would rather forget. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, and featuring one of the last performances by Roger Lloyd-Pack, who died in January

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: The hunt for the killer of a seemingly innocent family man brings Ronnie into contact with his old boss, former DI Natalie Chandler, whose father is accused of the crime. She wastes no time in persuading the detective to go above and beyond the call of duty to exonerate her dad and find the real culprit - even if that means getting him into trouble with an increasingly frustrated Wes. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, with Harriet Walter, Martin Jarvis and Roy Hudd

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete is questioned by police, but Miles leaks the story to the press, costing him his job. With his life unravelling, Pete realises he must dig into Miless murky past to save his family. Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Wayne and Marc are determined to be brutally honest, and Donna and David are forced to work closely with their rivals Fay and Ray during an afternoon team-building exercise. Over dinner, Damon admits that taking on the BandB, pub and restaurant all by himself may have not been the best decision - as proved when he has trouble running a solo breakfast service

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

Having already sold up in London, the pair are desperate to settle down with their three children but Kirstie thinks it might be their very specific wish list that is the problem. Camilla and Liam are struggling to keep up with the fast-moving market and can rarely book viewings before properties are sold so they ask Phil Spencer to help them in their search for a property to start a family in. With Nurse Camilla often working nightshifts, the pair are struggling to fit in some house hunting, after some time with Phil there are two contenders but some quick decisions must be made to avoid losing out yet again

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Clinton Dall from West Sussex, a self-made businessman and father of four aiming to build one of the largest homes ever featured on the show. Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic

In 2020, Kirstie and Phil met Elliot and James who were looking to find a home they could share with four bedrooms and an open plan entertaining space in London. programme.title: Grand Designs

programme.title: The Orient Express: A Golden Era of Travel
