programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margates most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Basildon, Essex, to meet nine-year-old Brandon, who suffers a severe form of epilepsy and can have up to 30 seizures a day. He requires 24-hour care and mum Jenny cant let him out of her sight for a moment - and to make matters worse, the family home simply isnt safe enough for the youngster. Luckily, the local tradesmen have heard of the familys plight and arrive in force to help Nick and the team transform the home, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Chef Nornie Bero presents a Mystery Box Challenge involving native Australian ingredients like emu fillet, yabbies, pepper berries, strawberry gum, saltbush and sunrise limes

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Documentary series following the paramedics of West Midlands Ambulance Service. Loz and Dan rush to a man who is fighting for breath with sudden chest pain

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary returns to capture life in the maternity unit at Liverpool Womens Hospital. Students Brooke and Tim, both aged 23, who became inseparable when they met in their first term at university, become parents for the first time and have difficulty deciding on a name for their baby, while things dont go according to plan in theatre for 40-year-old Hayley. She is afraid of being separated from her 23-year-old partner Nick, after he became critically ill during the pregnancy as a result of contracting pneumonia and septicaemia. Meanwhile, Tara, aged 36, has chosen her 16-year-old daughter Courtney as her birthing partner

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A head-on crash leaves two men in a critical condition, crashing a dirt bike on a remote farm ends badly for a 12-year-old, and a tourist gets the ride of her life

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A motorcyclist suffers a horrible injury, a husband performs life-saving CPR, a concussed mountain biker is found dazed and confused, and police have some VIP passengers

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The three semi-finalists upgrade lakeside holiday lodges in the heart of the Cotswolds, each of which includes an open-plan kitchen, living and dining space and an outside terrace. The buildings are decidedly beige, giving the designers a blank canvas to work on - and knowing they are only one week away from the final they really go to town, with schemes ranging from bold primary colours inspired by a classic 1980s movie to a sophisticated monochrome look. Michelle Ogundehin judges their efforts with help from designer Abigail Ahern

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Newport, Gwent, where he learns about the heroism of a young boy who was awarded the Albert Medal, before visiting a cinema dating from 1912 in Clevedon

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Taunton and Newton Abbot. Along the way he joins in with a fertility dance in Stogumber, visits a celebrated garden at Hestercombe to discover the fruits of an unusual partnership, and enjoys a trip aboard the longest heritage line in England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the trail of an historic achievement made at the dawn of the Edwardian era, Michael Portillo investigates the first radio signal to be sent across the Atlantic. Then, in Plymouth, he uncovers what happened to surviving crew members of the most famous ocean liner in history, the Titanic. Later, at Fowey, the former politician rediscovers a lost literary figure known as Q, who immortalised the town in his novels

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from East Yorkshire to Caernarfon, beginning by travelling from the city of Hull to the North Yorkshire market town of Malton

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek navigates the dry stone walls of the Peak District to collect a very original 1988 Opel Manta. Plus, Dave deals with a Ford Granada rally support vehicle

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has a three-hour drive in a 1960s bus that arrived in the UK after a life in the sun. Dave takes a Triumph TR7 convertible to auction

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.sub-title: The First Six Months in Power
programme.desc: It is 1933 and Adolf Hitler is the chancellor of Germany, but he does not have absolute power as there is still a democratic parliament, a head of state and the rule of law. Hitler calls a general election to increase Nazi representation, but a fire in the Reichstag building is blamed on communists - prompting thousands of arrests of left-wingers. Hitler then calls on President von Hindenburg to act and a decree is passed giving the Nazis emergency powers to ban free speech and the right to protest

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: Hitlers War moves to its endgame as the Soviets cross the German border - with a death toll of over 40 million, a new, scarred Europe will emerge

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team pay a second visit to Lowther Castle in Cumbria, where items include an army of Action Man figures, a skeletonised pendulum wall clock from the 1870s, a working child-sized car from the 1930s and a ring containing a gem that may or may not be worth a small fortune. Theres also an insight into Beatrix Potters scientific watercolours of woodland plants and animals - and her controversial work on the sex life of fungi

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum in Glasgow, where discoveries include jewellery made of mounted insects, a rare silver cup dating back to the time of Oliver Cromwell and a claymore sword from the Boer War. Other highlights include a large glass vase converted to a lamp, treasured childrens annuals featuring beloved Scottish character Oor Wullie and portraits linked to the Glasgow Boys school of artists

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team explore whether one wheel fewer means cheaper bills as they take on a three-wheeled wonder, the Reliant Robin

programme.title: Tropic of Cancer with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Stage four of Simons journey takes him across the areas of India rarely visited by tourists, including the unique desert environment of Little Rahn, home to the threatened wild ass, and Gandhis home city of Ahmedabad, where he sees evidence of ethnic tensions between Hindus and Muslims. In Bhopal, he finds a city still contaminated by chemicals 25 years after an infamous industrial accident, while in the city of Kolkata he ponders the congestion that continues to spiral out of control

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Will and Gus look to make some quick cash as they fix and wrap a Toyota MR2 MK2. Its quick and its cheap, but its the lowest spec out there and it looks dowdy

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Charlie head south for an immaculate Lotus Super 7. Derek and Jack are in Sheffield collecting a 1929 Riley Monaco and a 1924 Alvis 12/50 tourer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Derek picks out a super low mileage MGC and the team pays a little too much to secure it

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds two rare Fiats and a VW Corrado. Derek has his work cut out trying to remove an old Morris that appears to be supporting the garage roof. What could possibly go wrong?

programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien travel Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a handsome profit for their owners. Simon recycles some historic oak, while Henry comes unstuck when he tries to get to grips with an old Ford Escort

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a bloody battleground on the Pacific Island of Peleliu and an ominous military stronghold in Russia

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Edwardian Bradshaws guide, Michael Portillo conducts important research in an historic tea room, built by an Edwardian immigrant to the city of York. In Leeds he discovers the citys textile heritage, and also investigates Bradfords musical heritage

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels to the steel city of Sheffield where he discovers an early 20th century steam engine which produced armour plates for a Royal Navy warship. Then, Michael heads south into Nottinghamshire and to the former pit village of Eastwood, before arriving in Nantwich, where he takes a dip in the briny

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Liverpool and Wales. Along the way he discovers a childhood favourite - a miniature tank engine with three carriages in dark red - made by Frank Hornby, and learns the story of a Welsh countess who lived in Gwrych Castle. In Snowdonia, he also rides the waves with a Welsh surfing champion

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In picturesque Snowdonia, Michael Portillo braves the fastest zip line in the world - stretching 1,500 feet across a vast slate quarry as he begins the last leg of his journey to Caernarfon. En route, he also visits the home of British mountaineering, Pen y Gwryd, to hear how an Edwardian journalist and poet created a climbing community, which grew to include men who would conquer Everest in the 1950s

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves on his way to Grimsby to pick up an iconic 80s fast Ford, the Mk1 Fiesta XR2, while Bubbles regrets sitting in an immaculate Morris 1800 which hes now desperate to bid on

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owners pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: The final episode examines the infamous Night of the Long Knives in late June and early July of 1934, when Adolf Hitler - urged on by Hermann Goering and Heinrich Himmler - ordered a series of political executions on those seen as a threat to the Nazi regime. The most well-known of these was Ernst Roehm, commander and co-founder of the Sturmabteilung, the Nazi Partys militia, whom Hitler had come to see as a potential rival. At least 85 people died during the purge, although the final death toll may have been in the hundreds

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Documentary following the engineers and aviators who battle to keep the UKs most historic warplanes in the air. In the first edition, the team rebuild a Spitfire MJ772

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Barrington Court in Somerset, where discoveries include a toy Noahs Ark from the 1920s, an Elizabethan wine jug found at a car-boot sale and a £12 charity shop bracelet that dates back to the Victorian era. Among the other finds are a 16th-century silver cup constructed around a carved coconut, a vial of smelling salts with a mystery compartment and a collection of ceramic brewery figures that have seen better days

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The team returns to Barrington Court in Somerset, where Fiona Bruce examines the houses collection of distinctive wood paneling. Among the unusual finds brought in to be valued are a revolver that may have been owned by Buffalo Bill, a collection of rare German chocolate moulds, a set of signal flags used in the Normandy Landings, a pair of Russian ceramic figures and an engraved rock crystal, as well as a portrait of a woman wearing it

programme.desc: Eighteen years after vanishing from a holiday apartment in Praia da Luz, Portugal, the mystery of Madeleine McCanns disappearance remains unsolved. German prosecutors recently confirmed that Christian Brueckner, the man theyve long believed responsible, is set to be released from prison with no charges imminent in relation to Madeleines abduction and suspected murder. Criminologist Dr Graham Hill, a former senior Met detective who was in Portugal during the early stages of the investigation, returns to Praia da Luz. programme.desc: As the sleuth studies for his forthcoming sergeants exam, he investigates a hit-and-run that claimed the life of an eminent Oxford professor. programme.desc: In the ancient Forest of Dean, expert treehouse-builder Simon Parfett meets Jon and Michelle. programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team are on a mission to prove to the nation that you can achieve the home renovation of your dreams without it literally costing the earth. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as 2 households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings.
